page.title: 03MY HOUSE IN PURITON
page.content: Out side my{house}the pavement is cracked and we are joined to another house. The birds make a noise on the roof when they jump and nest.There are twelve houses in our row and we are the third house along.The road started to break up and so the workmen had to put down more tarmac.After nine houses there is an area of waste land which leads to the{Quarry.}Sometimes people keep cars and caravans on it.Then there are a few more houses and then there is an opening to the quarry. I live on an estate at 54 Puriton Park.We are joined to number 55.We have got a long garden and across the road they have shorter gardens because there are houses behind them.Behind our house and the other eleven is the quarry. By Joanne Davis.Age 9.
